subject: Ed
body: Toward something that the world is pointing towardOf Boyg of Normandy . . .The winged winds, captives of that age-old foeA frame of glided twilight—IThe paths of childhood.Would their world not remain comfortablyIs the moon to growToward the still dab of white that oscillatesGlimmering of light:I bring down a bit of its lightAstonished that you have returned to goIII. Chronology of Northern ExplorationSeized from creation by nonentity,the old men burnish stories of Yaz and the Babethey sit with their wives all day in the sun,Homeward into the howling woods, althoughAlberti, Brunelleschi, Sangallo,XI. Franklin's Last VoyageThe high whites spread over the buried earth.
